intro: Gomphocarpus abyssinicus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its striking orange and yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its leaves are alternate and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
